definition[0]: when someone is not allowed to take part in something or enter a place
example[0]: the country’s exclusion from the United Nations
definition[1]: when a child is officially made to leave their school because of their bad behaviour
definition[2]: something that is excluded from a contract
example[1]: You will be sent full details of the exclusions of your insurance policy.
definition[3]: a particular event or risk that is mentioned in an insurance policy as something that the policy does not cover
example[2]: Common exclusions in medical insurance policies are pregnancy, cosmetic surgery and treatment of AIDS.
definition[4]: an amount that would normally form part of a person’s or company’s total income, but on which tax does not have to be paid
example[3]: Customs are reviewing the current range of exclusions.
